A ''''' multi-professional team''''' is made up of professionals with different and complementary qualifications (e.g. doctors, pharmacists, nurses, physiotherapists, midwives, social workers, occupational therapists, dieticians, etc.). Multi-professional teamwork means that these professionals work together and combine their efforts to achieve a common goal.

This multi-professional teamwork is considered to be

- a safety barrier against adverse events;

- a factor in the quality of patient care ;

- a factor in health and well-being at work for professionals ;

- a way of responding collaboratively to patient needs.

question.title: What is multi-professional teamwork considered to be?

option_a.title: A way of responding collaboratively to patient needs
option_a.description: This is a plausible but incorrect option that is related to the concept of multi-professional teamwork

option_b.title: A factor in the quality of patient care
option_b.description: This is a correct option that is related to the concept of multi-professional teamwork

option_c.title: A safety barrier against adverse events
option_c.description: This is a correct option that is related to the concept of multi-professional teamwork

option_d.title: A factor in health and well-being at work for professionals
option_d.description: This is a correct option that is related to the concept of multi-professional teamwork

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
